revised_title: The Influence of Osmotic Pressure on Gunda ulvae Regeneration
tldr: This study investigates the effects of osmotic pressure on the regeneration of Gunda ulvae, a marine turbellarian. The research found that these worms can survive in a wide range of osmotic pressures, and regeneration occurs through a combination of regulatory and reductive changes. The worms' regeneration process involves the migration and transformation of parenchyma cells, which play a crucial role in forming new tissues and organs.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular Biology and Developmental Biology
